user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 is: A project shall not contain dead code.
Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code. Notes:
1. The behaviour of an embedded sytem is often determined not just by the nature of its actions, but also by the time at which they occur.
2. unreachable code is not dead code, as it cannot be executed.
3.Initialization is not the same as an assignment operation and is therfore not a candidate for dead code.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_file_size:
```c
lfs_soff_t lfs_file_size(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)file);
    LFS_ASSERT(lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));

    lfs_soff_t res = lfs_file_size_(lfs, file);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size -> %"PRIu32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_file_size:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
#define LFS_ASSERT(test) assert(test)
...
static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(struct lfs_mlist *head,
        struct lfs_mlist *node) {
    for (struct lfs_mlist **p = &head; *p; p = &(*p)->next) {
        if (*p == (struct lfs_mlist*)node) {
            return true;
        }
    }

    return false;
}
...
static lfs_soff_t lfs_file_size_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    (void)lfs;

#ifndef LFS_READONLY
    if (file->flags & LFS_F_WRITING) {
        return lfs_max(file->pos, file->ctz.size);
    }
#endif

    return file->ctz.size;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size -> %"PRIu32, res);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The LFS_TRACE macro is defined as an empty macro (#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__)). The source line LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size -> %"PRIu32, res); therefore expands to nothing and generates no executed code. MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 defines dead code as an operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect behaviour; since this trace call does not produce any executed operation, it is not dead code in the sense of the rule.
